title: Ticket #1659: unit test test_is_executable_true() failing
description:
This unit test was failing: 

TEST:  Test that IsExecutable() returns true for a file that is executable.
INPUT:
    Directory Path:  /home/condor/execute/dir_772/userdir/src/condor_tests/
    File Name:  condor_unit_tests
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  TRUE
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  FALSE
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 1541 (0.000259 seconds)

I found it failed because it assumed the current working directory was the same in which the condor_unit_test executable resided. This wasn't true when the unit tester was run in NMI.

I fixed it by specifically creating an executable file in the setup() function for that test file and using that instead. The newly created file is also cleaned up properly in the cleanup() function.

I also fixed a leaked fd while I was in there.
